Topic.Title: should i panic sell?

Message.Msg: This is a good time to sell and take profits with both Ebay and Amazon. The quiet negative factor that most have no clue about is the post office's January 27th international shipping rate hike. They doubled the shipping for both Canada and worldwide of packages 1 pound or less and raised by 50% packages between 1 and 4 pounds. When Non-U.S. buyers who like to buy from Americans see their shipping cost from 50-100%; many or most will no longer buy or bid a lot less on auctions. The post office's greedy and stupid rate hike will negative;y impact Ebay throughout the year and prevent share price from moving out of the $50 to $55 range. Most likely Ebay trades in the $40 to $53 range for the next year

Topic.Title: should i panic sell?

Message.Msg: Who cares about the post offices hike? international buyers are a fraction of the overall ebay sales on the us site. of those only a small % will care at all. You have no clue what you are talking about, this will have zero effect at all.

Message.Title: I'm an owner of a Ebay store
Message.Msg: I currently have 1556 items on sale.My sales are "up" 30%-40% year after year,my expenses are only 9-13% that includes shipping.And when I see something I want to buy I buy it only on Ebay I've been an Ebayer for 14 years and this selling and buying platform never stops 24/7 Paypal is amazing.Yes I'm an Ebay shareholder and "love' all aspects of this business.NO PANIC.

Topic.Title: I'm an owner of a Ebay store

Message.Msg: Did you forget to factor in those listing fees? 1500 items with a premium store will set you back $125 before you even make your first sale. What about that 4% Paypal fee? No way anyone with 1500+ items is shelling out 9-13% to eBay in fees. Trust me, I know, I have over 3000 items. Even with TRS powerseller discount I'm shelling out over 20% in fees. Not to mention, traffic has been down by nearly 40% year after year. Then there's the fact buyers on eBay want deep discounts, you have to compete with underpriced Chinese sellers.

Topic.Title: I'm an owner of a Ebay store

Message.Msg: Right.... Keep counting those pennies. Ever since eBay ditched Commission Junction and took the affiliate program in-house it's been a disaster.

Topic.Title: Tremendous Buying Opportunity Is Today @ $51.00 And Change!

Message.Msg: I'd have to disagree. Probably going to see eBay drop below $50 before the week is out. I just don't see this going to $75 anytime soon. The build-up last year from $30 to over $50 was smoke and mirrors based on skewed mobile figures and increased fees on sellers, namely fees charged on the shipping portion of a transaction. As for mobile users, eBay likes to tout the numbers as new customers. It's not, it's people accessing the web via phone or tablet instead of their desktop PC. Not to mention, Paypal is about to face a slew of challengers for online payment as well as mobile payments. In fact, one of the founders of Paypal has launched the mobile payments company Affirm.

Topic.Title: I'm an owner of a Ebay store

Message.Msg: You lie because what you say is mathematically impossible. You pay $49 in a monthly store fee and your final value fees are anywhere from 10-13% depending on what you sell. You also pay 3 cents per item per month, so your upfront fees before you even make a sale is $49 + $46 which is $95 before you even make a sale. Ebay also takes 10-13% of your shipping cost and Papal takes 3% plus a quarter for every sale you make. It's near impossible for any ebay store owner to pay under 20% in fees. You sound like another ebay seller who thinks hes doing great because you have no clue how to do simple math

Message.Title: paypal fees
Message.Msg: ebay makes more money in paypal fees than ebay commissions..that says it all. ebay won't allow sellers to accept cheaper forms of payment. i mean for powersellers they have no risk or no fraud. most fraud is by small time sellers, some of these powersellers have warehouse. more like merchants rather than flea market or garage seller sellers. powersellers commercial sellers is the bread and butter of ebay's business.

Topic.Title: paypal fees

Message.Msg: Final value fees are 8-12% including the shipping amount, that's not including 4% Paypal fees, listing and store fees. I have over 3000 items for sale on eBay and it costs me $200 per month just to list there before anything has sold. Then I get whacked for 16% on each sale. It wouldn't be so bad if eBay had the traffic and sales the used to but sales are down by nearly 70% since 2010. That's why eBay is tanking,
